Message:
The garden is blanketed in snow.
Before my eyes, straw posts
stand silently side by side.

Crisp is the morning air—
perfect for training.
It clears the mind,
sharpening one’s senses.

After drawing in the freezing air,
I swing my great katana.

Upon hearing the straw posts
fall to the ground,
a slow breath escapes my lips.

I sheathed my blade and
examined the straw posts...
As I feared, every cut
was far from clean.

’Twas clear that my strikes
were losing their edge,
yet the cause eluded me.

With uncertainty clouding
my mind, I entered battle,
yet failed to fell the enemy...

Though the Duke told me
I needn’t fret, ’tis unacceptable
for me to go on like this.

The blade is my
only saving grace.
Beyond it, I have nothing.

If I am unable to
wield this katana,
then what purpose
do I even serve...?
